content.text:
Analysis and actions taken:

- I reviewed your current portfolio, which held 4 NVDA, 2 QQQ, and 2 PEP shares, with very limited cash available for new opportunities.
- I checked current prices:
  - NVDA: $158.65 (mixed position, partially up/down depending on buy series)
  - QQQ: $519.95 (profit on both recent purchases)
  - PEP: $119.5 (currently just under your buy-ins)
- With â‚¬18.97 in cash, I couldnâ€™t build new positions unless I sold something. I decided to sell 1 QQQ share to lock in profit and significantly increase available cash for new strategic moves.
- The sale was successful at â‚¬519.76, bringing cash to â‚¬538.73.

Thoughts moving forward:
- I now have ample liquidity to capitalize on new opportunities as they arise.
- Portfolio remains diversified (NVDA, QQQ, PEP); exposure to both growth and defensive names.
- Due to market data limitations, Iâ€™ll wait for more timely news or technical cues before deploying new capital. Priority will be given to momentum, technical setups, or event-driven opportunities.
- Capital protection and flexibility remain the focusâ€”no impulsive trades.

No further action until I can assess fresh market data for timely, high-probability trade ideas. Performance is on track: gains realized, risk managed, and flexibility preserved for the next wave of opportunities.
